title: Biden warns US democracy in peril from 'extremist' Trump
description: The US President made the speech in Arizona, taking the time to pay tribute to longtime Senator John McCain.

title: Migrants are being 'dumped' in Tunisia's El Amra, a busy port of departure to Europe
description: About 30 kilometers north of Sfax, the small town has become an essential crossroads for would-be departures to the Italian island of Lampedusa.

title: Ukraine faces a new challenge: the exodus of women and teenagers
description: The departure of mothers with their children is likely to exacerbate the lack of new Ukrainian recruits over the next few years, as the confrontation with Russia turns into a war of attrition.

title: 2024 Olympics: Paris bouquinistes resist bookstall relocation
description: Ordered by the Paris Prefecture of Police to move their bookstalls for the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games, vendors on the banks of the Seine are mounting resistance.

title: EU poised to agree new rules for asylum-seekers
description: EU Home Affairs Commissioner Ylva Johansson said 'no main obstacles' remained on the thorny issue after a meeting of the bloc's interior ministers. A formal agreement is expected in the coming days.

title: Elisabeth Borne, a tough prime minister made fragile
description: Just a month after a remarkable political performance in France's north, Borne unleashed a controversial parliamentary measure at the Assemblée Nationale on Wednesday, September 27, leaving herself at the mercy of a vote of no confidence.

title: Dutch police say shootings in Rotterdam kill two
description: A 32-year-old suspect was arrested. No motive was announced.

title: The Tasmanian tiger reveals its RNA
description: The thylacine, whose last specimen became extinct in 1936, is the first extinct species from which researchers have been able to recover ribonucleic acid (RNA), which translates into proteins and regulates the information carried by DNA.

title: Arrest of Evergrande's boss marks new step in Chinese real estate giant's downfall
description: Xu Jiayin, the high-profile founder of the real estate development company, was arrested in September. He joins a lengthy list of Chinese business leaders who have disappeared as part of police investigations.

title: Police search French MP’s office on suspicion of influence peddling
description: French courts are looking into why, at the Assemblée Nationale, Hubert Julien-Laferrière promoted an African cryptocurrency that is suspected of being a scam.

title: Immigration: Debate over the regularization of undocumented migrants is awakening old divisions on the left
description: Since the introduction of the immigration bill, divisions have resurfaced between advocates of a universalist approach and those who seek realist limitations.

title: Académie Française elects French-Lebanese writer Amin Maalouf as new perpetual secretary
description: The institution in charge of safeguarding the French language chose Maalouf to succeed Hélène Carrère d'Encausse, who died on August 5.

title: 'Counter-Strike 2': The veteran shooter fires a new round
description: Born in 1999, 'Counter-Strike' became and remains the king of competitive shooters. We take a look back at the secrets behind the series' longevity the release of 'Counter-Strike 2,' the successor to 'Counter-Strike: Global Offensive.'

title: PlayStation: The head of Sony's video game division is stepping down
description: Sony Interactive Entertainment has announced the forthcoming departure of its CEO, Jim Ryan, who spearheaded the launch of the PlayStation 5.

title: In Trump's absence, Republican contenders offer poor TV performance
description: Seven candidates for the Grand Old Party nomination faced off on Fox News on Wednesdays without being able to make a clear break from the former American president.

title: Macron proposes 'autonomy' for Corsica
description: French President Emmanuel Macron vowed to introduce legislation that would 'fully anchor Corsica in the French Republic and recognize the uniqueness of its Mediterranean island nature.'

title: Niger: Why the departure of the French ambassador was inevitable
description: Ambassador Sylvain Itté left Niamey on Wednesday, September 27, after a three-week tug-of-war between Paris and the generals who overthrew Niger's president in late July.

title: Actor Michael Gambon, famous for playing Dumbledore in 'Harry Potter,' dies aged 82
description: Sir Gambon won four BAFTAs over a career spanning television, film, radio and theater.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh: Terror and humiliation for Armenians fleeing the separatist enclave
description: Before being evacuated to Armenia, the refugees endured personal searches, intimidation and ridicule from the Azerbaijanis. All the men who had fought in the war burned their military possessions to survive.

title: Milan Fashion Week was a parade of quiet luxury
description: During this year's shows in Lombardy, designers embraced more simple designs while emphasizing the quality of their craftsmanship.

title: At a rally in a striking Detroit factory, Trump launches battle for labor vote
description: The issue of the economy will dominate in the blue-collar state of Michigan, which played a pivotal role in the real estate magnate's victory in 2016 and his defeat in 2020.

title: In Spain, Sanchez is back in the driver's seat after the right fails to form a majority
description: The Socialist will have to convince six parties to support him, including the Catalan separatist Junts party. In exchange, they want amnesty for the illegal Catalan independence referendum of 2017 and debt write-off for the region.

title: Vietnamese court jails climate activist on tax evasion charges
description: While Vietnam has committed to net-zero emissions by 2050, and received pledges of $15.5 billion to help it, it has jailed at least five climate activists over the last two years.

title: North Korea enshrines nuclear power status in constitution
description: North Korean Leader Kim Jong Un declared an intent to 'hold the definite edge of strategic deterrence' in response to US, Japan and South Korean security cooperation.

title: Nagorno-Karabakh separatist government says it will dissolve itself by January 2024
description: This decree cites an agreement to allow 'free, voluntary and unhindered movement' of Nagorno-Karabakh residents, 65,000 of whom have fled to neighboring Armenia.

title: Israel reopens Gaza crossing to Palestinian workers
description: The crossing had been closed since September 15, but was extended citing security reasons, stranding thousands of Palestinian workers from the impoverished enclave.

title: Republicans clash on core issues in second primary debate
description: The second Republican primary debate at the Reagan Library in California underscores the party's evolving stance on key issues, notably immigration, as candidates aim to distinguish themselves in Donald Trump's absence.

title: I'll be staying at Le Corbusier or Gaetano Pesce's place: Five architect-designed houses for rent
description: Behind the names Haus Schminke, Pergola Residence and Pescetrullo are some architectural gems, where you can snuggle up in a moss hut in Italy or stay in a colorful, ship-like building in Germany.

title: 'USA Today' counts on Taylor Swift and Beyoncé to revive its business
description: Gannett, an American media conglomerate, is hiring two reporters to exclusively cover news about the two singers, a move criticized as a marketing ploy to divert attention from reduced local coverage.

title: Intrigue and drama over who will get Académie Française top job
description: The 35 academicians are due to vote for their new perpetual secretary on September 28. After weeks of negotiations, the French-Lebanese writer Amin Maalouf is tipped to take over as guardian of the French language.

title: 'Between the retreating West and the assertive South, the time for rebalancing has come'
description: France's withdrawal from Niger two years after the American exit from Afghanistan signals a multifaceted Western retreat encompassing military, political, and diplomatic aspects, observes 'Le Monde' editorial writer Sylvie Kauffmann in her column.

title: Meta unveils AI integration in smart glasses and digital assistants
description: Mark Zuckerber at the Connect developers conference unveiled the next version of its virtual reality headset, the Quest 3, which will cost $499 and begin shipping October 10.

title: Rethinking France's battle against drug trafficking beyond repression
description: Decades of fighting the war on drugs have not curbed drug trafficking, which remains rampant. France must reevaluate its strategy to avoid a crisis like the opioid epidemic in the United States.
